# The `raw_fd_ostream` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> that writes to a file descriptor. <a href="#details">More...</a>

<CodeBlock>class llvm::raw_fd_ostream</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> that writes to a file descriptor.

Definition at line 460 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Constructors

### raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream() {#af5462bc0fe5a61eccc662708da280e64}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream::raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Filename, std::error&#95;code &amp; EC)</>}>
Open the specified file for writing.

If an error occurs, information about the error is put into EC, and the stream should be immediately destroyed; <code>Flags</code> allows optional flags to control how the file will be opened.

As a special case, if Filename is &quot;-&quot;, then the stream will use STDOUT&#95;FILENO instead of opening a file. This will not close the stdout descriptor.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00514">514</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp/#l00591">591</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp">raw&#95;ostream.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream() {#a8006c8875484467031d61b1e671cfede}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream::raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream (int fd, bool shouldClose, bool unbuffered=false, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream/#ad85a9ad7858d658c954afde33bcf3d43">OStreamKind</a> K=<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream/#ad85a9ad7858d658c954afde33bcf3d43a2bdd687fb19e606203cb02f5c50bf07b">OStreamKind::OK&#95;OStream</a>)</>}>
FD is the file descriptor that this writes to.

If ShouldClose is true, this closes the file when the stream is destroyed. If FD is for stdout or stderr, it will not be closed.

If ShouldClose is true, this closes the file when the stream is destroyed.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00528">528</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp/#l00617">617</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp">raw&#95;ostream.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### clear&#95;error() {#a7b4fefe70f73556669fd513ed9d0fae4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream::clear&#95;error ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set the flag read by <a href="#a0d5a564fb5459ab9ce6e56401786542b">has&#95;error()</a> to false.

If the error flag is set at the time when this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a>&#39;s destructor is called, report&#95;fatal&#95;error is called to report the error. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> <a href="#a7b4fefe70f73556669fd513ed9d0fae4">clear&#95;error()</a> after handling the error to avoid this behavior.

&quot;Errors should never pass silently.
   Unless explicitly silenced.&quot;
<ul>
<li>from The Zen of Python, by Tim Peters</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00573">573</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### close() {#a293545f9b5864a8e1b33e57becbc5b3a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream::close ()</>}>
Manually flush the stream and close the file.

Note that this does not call fsync.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00535">535</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp/#l00804">804</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp">raw&#95;ostream.cpp</a>.

### has&#95;colors() {#a8e526ce08487bfff0b9befaea2324cce}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream::has&#95;colors () const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This function determines if this stream is displayed and supports colors.

The result is unaffected by calls to enable&#95;color().

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00547">547</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp/#l00868">868</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp">raw&#95;ostream.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### has&#95;error() {#a0d5a564fb5459ab9ce6e56401786542b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream::has&#95;error () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the value of the flag in this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-fd-ostream">raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream</a> indicating whether an output error has been encountered.

This doesn&#39;t implicitly flush any pending output. Also, it doesn&#39;t guarantee to detect all errors unless the stream has been closed.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00562">562</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### is&#95;displayed() {#a0c2a4031566b90f46f0dc8329e670598}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream::is&#95;displayed () const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This function determines if this stream is connected to a &quot;tty&quot; or &quot;console&quot; window.

That is, the output would be displayed to the user rather than being put on a pipe or stored in a file.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00545">545</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp/#l00864">864</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp">raw&#95;ostream.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lock() {#a5a33d325e887c5cfa94e8abac79145b3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; sys::fs::FileLocker &gt; raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream::lock ()</>}
  labels = {["nodiscard"]}>
Locks the underlying file.

<SectionUser title="Returns">
RAII object that releases the lock upon leaving the scope, if the locking was successful. Otherwise returns corresponding error code.
</SectionUser>

The function blocks the current thread until the lock become available or error occurs.

Possible use of this function may be as follows:


<ProgramListing extension="cpp">

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> L = stream.lock()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ... do action that require file to be locked.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2aa0f5c36ac6291f5d5f2b4efd9ffe70">handleAllErrors</a>(std::move(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ead20caec3b48a1eef164cb4ca81ba2587">L</a>.takeError()), &#91;&amp;&#93;(ErrorInfoBase &amp;EIB) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ... handle lock error.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00595">595</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp/#l00874">874</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp">raw&#95;ostream.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### tie() {#a63dfdb79daa6f106196f4acc2748ce43}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream::tie (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &#42; TieTo)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Tie this stream to the specified stream.

Replaces any existing tied-to stream. Specifying a nullptr unties the stream. This is intended for to tie <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9a7b5c68c90f85baaedaa854cc5002cc">errs()</a> to <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2d79a00fa7c56f57b87f2fe2a3f118c7">outs()</a>, so that <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2d79a00fa7c56f57b87f2fe2a3f118c7">outs()</a> is flushed whenever something is written to <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9a7b5c68c90f85baaedaa854cc5002cc">errs()</a>, preventing weird and hard-to-test output when stderr is redirected to stdout.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00554">554</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### tryLockFor() {#add43014c83b068e09ccf25789ee0af48}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; sys::fs::FileLocker &gt; raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream::tryLockFor (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/duration">Duration</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> &amp; Timeout)</>}
  labels = {["nodiscard"]}>
Tries to lock the underlying file within the specified period.

<SectionUser title="Returns">
RAII object that releases the lock upon leaving the scope, if the locking was successful. Otherwise returns corresponding error code.
</SectionUser>

It is used as <a href="#a5a33d325e887c5cfa94e8abac79145b3">lock</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00605">605</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp/#l00882">882</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-ostream-cpp">raw&#95;ostream.cpp</a>.
